features: Advanced Ergonomic Design: Designed as 57 degree natural grip and keep your forearm muscle under natural position, making movement smoother and more flexible, reducing arm discomfort and effectively relieving wrist pain. Compared with traditional mouse, with unique ergonomic vertical mouse design, it may take a few days to get used to using it.

4 Adjustable DPI: Switch between DPI levels 800, 1200, 2400 and 3200 to adjust mouse responsiveness depending on your need and preference. Such as browsing the website, editing a diagram, drawing a picture, etc.

Plug and Play: The computer mouse no drivers required, plug and play wired mouse with 1.8m cable and USB 2.0 interface, easily accessible with standard setup features. Portable and lightweight, very easy to carry and store. The lightweight design of the mouse helps to improve posture, reduce pressure on wrists and muscles, and bring you a more comfortable office experience.

11 RGB Lighting: The ergonomic mouse features RGB lighting that illuminates the outline of the mouse. Users can adjust the underglow depending on their preference to add a different working experience.

Featured Buttons: All buttons are easy to operate and won't twist your fingers. The Forward/Backward button is in an exact place and will help you greatly improve your efficiency. The button power is light and easy to click. Plus, metal non-slip scroll offers great durable quality. Note: Forward/Backward buttons are not compatible with MAC OS. All the buttons are non-programmable.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: MEASURE YOUR HAND, CHOOSE THE RIGHT MOUSE M504 is a great fit for medium-sized hands.
Ergonomic Vertical Mouse Compared with traditional mouse, with unique ergonomic design, it may take a few days to get used to using it.

Are the buttons of this mouse programmable? All the buttons are non-programmable. Forward/Backward/Desktop buttons are not compatible with MAC OS. What size hand is this mouse suitable for? Nulea M504 wired vertical mouse is perfect for Medium Hands. Why is the vertical mouse so light to hold? The lightweight design of the mouse helps to improve posture, reduce pressure on wrists and muscles, and bring you a more comfortable office experience.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wow, really nice, this is what I like...
reviews.reviewText: So first thing is it has a wire, I prefer a wired mouse they just seem to work better. Great Tracking very comfortable and decent action and click is not too loud. The outside has a soft touch but is a plastic maybe they put a coating on it or something and is very good. This thing has different selectable colors, actually got one that matches my PC and looks pretty good on the desk.When I use this mouse I can change the DPI easily, turn the light on/off or a different color. I think the wheel is metal and has got to be the best I have ever used, it is easy to roll and grips to your finger nicely. It has the press in on the wheel so you can do the autoscroll etc. Yeah this thing is great.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I have bought three of these now, in three different colors. Well packaged, looks awesome, and the wired version is nice because there’s no messing around with connectivity. I just preferred the good old fashioned ease of a wired mouse.I have noticed improvement in my wrist and hand pain. I recommend ergonomic mice to everyone.If I had one complaint, it would be that the material of the outside/shell of the mouse, while smooth and comfortable, has no grip. If you want to pick the mouse up or reposition it on your mousepad, it’s nearly impossible to grab and lift. Your fingers slide right off. I have to grip my fingers under the bottom edge to lift and move. Very minor, doesn’t affect my rating, but something worth mentioning I think.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Seems good so far
reviews.reviewText: This is my first time trying a vertical mouse, so I can't speak to how it compares to others on the market, but so far I like it a lot. It's very comfortable to rest your hand on, and it has all the functionality of a traditional mouse (including forward and back buttons) so I don't feel like I'm missing out on anything by using it. I don't think I'm quite as accurate with it as with my old mouse (at least not yet), but it's not a steep learning curve; within two minutes I was browsing the web as normal without really thinking about it.For the price, the build quality and featureset is surprisingly good. The soft-touch finish and metal scroll wheel make it easy to forget that it's not a more expensive name-brand product. There are a few minor details that let it down a little, however:- There's no configuration software or on-board memory, so they mouse is reset any time it loses power. You can choose between 4 DPI levels with the button behind the scroll wheel, but there's no indication of which option is selected and you'll be back to the default as soon as you unplug it or turn off your computer. You're better off just changing the pointer speed in your OS.- The LEDs are fun, but there's so many different patterns that you probably won't bother to cycle around to your favorite every time. Mine also has a strange uneven pink hue in the white mode which detracts from the look somewhat. It feels like the lighting was added mostly for the sake of the product photo. That said, you can hold down the top button to turn it off if you want (at least until you unplug it, sigh).- The base is a little bit smaller than the full size of the mouse, so I sometimes tilt it over to the left unintentionally. It's not a huge problem but I'm not sure why the base couldn't be slightly wider to prevent this.Despite the flaws, I think this is a great mouse for someone that wants to try out a more ergonomic design without spending too much. The clicks click, the scroll scrolls, and the size seems like it would work for most people.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great mouse at a great price
reviews.reviewText: I thought there would be an adjustment period but right out the box this mouse felt natural in my hand. The buttons are exactly where you expect them to be and I seamlessly just started using it without even having to think about it. Very comfortable and ergonomic.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Really Cool Mouse!
reviews.reviewText: I think this is a really good mouse so far! It's definitely different from any mouse I've used before, so I'm still getting used to it. But let me tell you, it seems to be much more comfortable to use than a standard mouse. I'm using it for work so not sure how well it does for gaming. Overall, I think it's a great deal and hopefully it last a while.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great mouse if you are struggling with arm pain
reviews.reviewText: I bought this mouse to relieve stress on my arm from a compressed nerve in my neck. Works great and is very comfortable to use. It takes some getting used to but I adjusted quickly. I do wish there was a bit more of a skirt under the hand. As it is my hand either drags across the table or I have to actively hold it up a bit. But for the price this is an excellent entry into ergonomic vertical mice.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars An easy adjustment
reviews.reviewText: The feel and the look of this mouse are great, mine hasn't given me any problems unlike some of the reviews I read. I have been using this mouse for a little over a month and its been great, so far.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable and sturdy; buttons don't last though.
reviews.reviewText: Update: After almost a year, the left button has started to fail. I have to place my finger in JUST the right spot and press VERY hard, or it doesn't register. Tried cleaning it, moving it to another USB slot, etc, but now it's becoming a chore to use. Will have to find another model when I get a new mouse; I like my hardware to last more than a year, and this one fell a month short of that. Disappointing, because I liked this one, but I won't buy another one if it's just going to fail.Once I tried a vertical mouse, I couldn't go back. However, I made the mistake of getting wireless models- they're prone to scroll wheel issues and a short overall battery life.This one has a sturdy metal scroll wheel that has a good feel to it, and the texture of the mouse itself is nice and smooth with a slight softness to it that doesn't get sticky or tacky. I marked off a star for gaming because it's not a gaming mouse, but it does alright for a casual MMO player like me.My carpal tunnel has thanked me for this mouse- yours will, too.
The media could not be loaded. Muy ligero buen tamaño y como es por cable no hay que preocuparse por estarlo cargando, las luces Led le dan un buen toque

J'ai du retourner ce produit car elle était trop grande pour ma main.J'ai hésité entre 2 souris et j'ai choisis l'autre la plus petite mais celle-ci était parfaite pour mon conjoint avec de grandes mains.J'aime le fait qu'elle ait un fil, j'ai tendance à croire que la connexion est meilleure. On peut modifier les couleurs avec le bouton sur le dessus.Ce que j'ai moins aimé c'est que les boutons forward et back sont en haut du pouce et c'est moins facile coir ergonomique comme utilisation. C'est cette différence qui m'a fait choisir un autre modèle.Je la recommande!

Scoperti questi mouse verticali per limitare sforzi al polso visto uso prolungato quotidiano, da allora li uso costantemente. Questo in particolare ha sensibikita regolabile ma troppo lenta o troppo veloce e i piedini sotto andrebbero resi meno scivolosi (ma dipende su quale superficie lo si usa) perché basta un minimo tremore del polso al momento del click per sbilanciarlo e spostarlo appena, facendo fallire l’apertura dei file col doppio click. Basta forse abituarsi alla sensibilita e al movimento diverso dai mouse tradizionali in cui il click verso il basso stabilizza il mouse mentre nei verticali il click verso il lato sposta il mouse involtariamente
Souris ergonomique, niquel pour les poignées fragile, super intuitive
Souris ergonomique, super sensible, un régal, j'en ai une pour la maison une pour le travail et je souffre moins du canal carpien !! Au top
